Login

       Description

Login to controller with valid username and password.

       Request Parameters

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Type: String

Valid value: "login"

Default: None

Required: Yes

username

The user name for the account.

Type: String

Valid Value: "admin" or an existing user account name

Default: None

Required: Yes

password

The password for the account user. For security and usability, we recommend you use the password in POST request. Using password in GET would require you to url encode any special characters in password.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

 

       Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

CID

API session ID

Type: String

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty string if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty string if return is "false"

 

       Example Request (POST) (Recommended way)

Available in 3.1 or later release.

curl -k --data "action=login" --data "username=admin" --data "password=Aviatrix123!" "https://10.123.123.123/v1/api"

 

       Example Request (POST) (Recommended way)

Available in 3.0 & 3.0.1 & 3.0.2 releases.

curl -k --data "password=Aviatrix123!" "https://10.123.123.123/v1/api?action=login&username=admin"

 

       Example Request (GET) (Deprecated).

To use in version 2.7 or earlier version.

https://10.123.123.123/v1/api?action=login&username=admin&password=password

 

       Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "results": "User login:admin in account:admin has been authorized successfully — Please check email confirmation.",

  "CID": "57e098ed708a8"

}

 

{

  "return": false,

  "reason": "User name\/password does not match"

}

    Forget Controller Password

 

  Description

Forget Controller Password.

This API is available in version 3.2 or later releases.

Request Method: POST

  Request Parameters

action

This parameter indicates which Aviatrix API is being invoked.

Type: String

Valid value: "forget_controller_password"

Default: None

Required: Yes

username

This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

Type: string

Default: None

Required: YES

  Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request when return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: This field is an empty string when return is "true"

results

API response results when return value is true

Type: String

Valid Values: This field is an empty string when return value is "false"

  Example Request

# curl -k --data "action=forget_controller_password" --data "username=david" "https://CONTROLLER_IP/v1/api"

  Example Response 

{
    "return": true,
    "results": "One time token has been sent to rya*****@aviatrix.com successfully - Please check email."
}


         Setup Admin E-mail Address

       Description

Setup admin user’s e-mail address. This API is required for initial setup.

       Request Parameters

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Type: String

Valid value: "add_admin_email_addr"

Default: None

Required: Yes

CID

API session ID

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

admin_email

E-mail address of admin user to be set.

Type: String

Valid Value: Any valid e-mail address

Default: None

Required: Yes

 

       Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty string if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty string if return is "false"

 

       Example Request

https://192.168.0.251/v1/api?action=add_admin_email_addr&admin_email=test@abc.xyz&CID=54557b087a48a

       Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "results": "admin email address has been successfully added"

}

         Initial Setup

 

       Description

Run UCC(cloud Aviatrix controller) initial-setup if the value of "subaction" is "run". Check if initial-setup has been run already or not.

Available in the version 3.0 or later release.

       Request Parameters

subaction

The subaction whether to run or check.

Type: String

Valid value: "run" or "check"

Default: None

Required: Yes

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Type: String

Valid value: "initial_setup"

Default: None

Required: Yes

target_version

target_version the version to upgrade to on initial setup

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No. If target_version is not present, initial_setup upgrades to latest version. While the api is api is available since 3.0 this field was added since 3.1.5

CID

API session ID

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

       Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty string if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Available in 3.0 or later release. After issuing this api, user needs to wait 180 seconds

Valid Values: result is empty string if return is "false"

       Example Request

https://192.168.0.251/v1/api?CID=54557b087a48a&action=initial_setup&subaction=run

       Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "results": 180

}

Default: None

Valid value: "setup_customer_id"

Required: Yes

Default: None

Required: Yes

       Response Elements

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty string if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty string if return is "false"

       Example Request

https://192.168.0.251/v1/api?CID=54557b087a48a&action=setup_customer_id&customer_id=carmelodev-1234567898.64

    Get Azure Storage Accounts

 

  Description

Get Azure storage accounts.

  Request Parameters

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Type: String

Valid value: "az_get_storage_accounts"

Default: None

Required: Yes

CID

API session ID.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

cloud_type

Type of cloud service provider.

Type: Integer

Default: None

Required: Yes

2: Azure

8: ARM

512: Azure China (UCC only)

2048: ARM China (UCC only)

account_name

Account name.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_reg

Region name.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

with_image

Indicates whether to retrieve storage names with image or not.

Type: String

Valid value: "yes" or "no"

Default: "no"

Required: No

  Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty string if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty string if return is "false"

 

  Example Request

https://52.25.2.137/v1/api?CID=55e7af8e4beb8&action=az_get_storage_accounts&cloud_type=2&account_name=BusinessOps

  Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "results": [

    "01portalvhds0m4dg25td2kd",

    "y1portalvhdsx31w3rbncl0w"

  ]

}

         Create Account

 

       Description

Create an account. This has to be done by an admin. This account can be used to login to CloudN console or UserConnect controller.

       Request Parameters

CID

The session id (API Key) that was returned during login.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid value: "setup_account_profile"

Default: None

Required: Yes

account_name

Account name. This can be used for logging in to CloudN console or UserConnect controller.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

account_password

Password for the account.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

account_email

Account email address where notifications will be sent.

Method: POST

Type: email

Default: None

Required: Yes

cloud_type

Type of cloud service provider.

Method: POST

Type: integer

Default: None

Required: Yes

1: AWS

2: Azure

4: Gcloud (UCC only)

8: ARM

256: AWS GOV (UCC only)

512: Azure China (UCC only)

1024: AWS China (UCC only)

2048: ARM China (UCC only)

e.g.: When you create an account for AWS and Azure, cloud_type should be 3(1+2).

aws_account_number

AWS Account number

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for AWS

aws_iam

AWS IAM-role based flag, this option is for UserConnect.

Method: POST

Valid value: "true"

Default: "false"

Required: No

aws_access_key

AWS Access Key

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when aws_iam is "false" and when creating an account for AWS

aws_secret_key

AWS Secret Key

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when aws_iam is "false" and when creating an account for AWS

aws_role_arn

AWS role ARN, this option is for UserConnect.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when aws_iam is "true" and when creating an account for AWS

aws_role_ec2

AWS role EC2, this option is for UserConnect.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when aws_iam is "true" and when creating an account for AWS

azure_subscription_id

Azure subscription ID

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for Azure

gcloud_project_name

(UCC only)

Gcloud project name

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for Gcloud

gcloud_project_credentials

(UCC only)

The Gcloud project credential file path on the controller

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

arm_subscription_id

Azure RM subscription ID

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

arm_application_endpoint

Azure RM Application Endpoint

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

arm_application_client_id

Azure RM Application client ID

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

arm_application_client_secret

Azure RM Application client secret

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

awsgov_account_number

(UCC only)

AWS GOV account number

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for AWS GOV

awsgov_access_key

(UCC only)

AWS GOV access key

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for AWS GOV

awsgov_secret_key

(UCC only)

AWS GOV secret key

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for AWS GOV

awsgov_cloudtrail_bucket

(UCC only)

AWS GOV cloudtrail bucket

Method: POST

Type: String

Required: No

azurechina_subscription_id

Azure China subscription ID

Default: None

(UCC only)

AWS China account number

Method: POST

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for AWS China

(UCC only)

AWS China access key

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for AWS China

awschina_secret_key

(UCC only)

AWS China secret key

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when creating an account for AWS China

arm_china_subscription_id

(UCC only)

Azure RM China subscription ID

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

arm_china_application_endpoint

(UCC only)

Azure RM China Application Endpoint

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

(UCC only)

Azure RM China Application client ID

Default: None

Required: No

(UCC only)

Azure RM China Application client secret

Method: POST

       Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty string if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty string if return is "false"

 

       Example Request

https://192.168.0.251/v1/api

Method: POST

{

  "CID": "54557b087a48a",

  "action": "setup_account_profile",

  "account_name": "user2",

  "account_password": "12345",

  "account_email": "example@abc.com",

  "cloud_type": "1",

  "aws_account_number": "992805288348",

  "aws_access_key": "AKIAIWDAABCPKKKWQA",

  "aws_secret_key": "9ttSeSnQvb\/OlWZKCjyPsbcdYgamthksK2+1G"

}

 

The example below shows how to use curl command when aws_secret_key has a plus sign.

 

Curl —k —data "CID=55d26cc728d70" —data "action=setup_account_profile" —data "account_name=devtest" —data "account_password=password" —data "account_email=customer123@youremail.com" —data "cloud_type=1" —data "aws_account_number=123456789012" —data "aws_access_key=AKIAIYMGUXF6HY7NJ3XQ" —data-urlencode "aws_secret_key=TjAs4T4G1S962vzJFJk/wUI7TVF3qKW+twJ75Lka" "https://192.168.0.251/v1/api"

       Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "results": "An email with instructions has been sent to customer123@youremail.com"

}

Required: YES

    Create an Aviatrix Gateway (Connect Legacy VPC/Vnet)))

 

  Description

This API applies to both CloudN (on-prem virtual appliance) and UCC (cloud controller).

For UCC, this API creates an Aviatrix gateway and launches it.

For CloudN, this API connects a legacy VPC/Vnet.

 

  Request Parameters

CID

The session id (API Key) that was returned during login.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid value: "connect_container"

Default: None

Required: Yes

cloud_type

Type of cloud service provider.

Method: POST

Type: Integer

Default: None

Required: Yes

1: AWS

2: Azure

4: Gcloud (UCC only)

8: ARM

256: AWS GOV (UCC only)

512: Azure China (UCC only)

1024: AWS China (UCC only)

2048: ARM China (UCC only)

account_name

Account Name to use for launching this container.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: an existing account name

Default: None

Required: Yes

gw_name

A unique name of the container.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: [a-z|A-Z|0-9|\s|\/|\+|\@|\:|\.|\-]+

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_reg

A region where this container will be launched.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "us-east-1"

Default: None

Required: Yes when cloud_type is not 4.

zone

A GCE zone where this container will be launched.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when cloud_type is 4.

vpc_net

A VPC Network address range selected from one of the available network ranges.

Method: POST

Type: String, in a format of "Subnet_CIDR~~Subnet_AZ~~Subnet_name". e.g.: "172.16.32.0/20~~us-west-1a~~MySubnet"

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_size

Size of Gateway Instance.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "t2.micro"

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_id

A string that is consisted of VPC/Vnet name and cloud provider's (AWS/ARM/GCloud) resource name. Examples are below...

     Syntax (AWS): VPC_ID~~VPC_NAME_TAG

     Example (AWS): vpc-abcd1234~~my-vpc-02

     Example (AWS): vpc-abcd1234~~NoName (if the VPC has no name tag)

     Syntax (ARM): VNET_NAME:RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME

     Example (ARM): myVNet01:myResourceGroupInWestUS

     Syntax (GCloud): VPC_NAME Example: mygcloudvpc01

     Example (GCloud): mygcloudvpc01

Notes: Please check the "Gateway" page on Aviatrix controller GUI for the precise value if needed.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

enable_nat

Enable NAT for this container.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "yes" or "no"

Valid Values: "yes" to enable NAT, and "no" to disable it

Default: "no"

Required: No

vpn_access

Enable user access through VPN to this container.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "yes" or "no"

Valid Values: "yes" to enable user access through VPN, and "no" to disable it

Default: "no"

Required: No

cidr

VPN CIDR block for the container.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "172.16.33.0/20"

Default: None

Required: Yes if vpn_access is "yes"

otp_mode

Two step authentication mode.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: "2": DUO, "3": Okta

Default: None

Required: No

duo_integration_key

Integration key for DUO auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if otp_mode is "2"

duo_secret_key

Secret key for DUO auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if otp_mode is "2"

duo_api_hostname

API hostname for DUO auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if otp_mode is "2"

duo_push_mode

Push mode for DUO auth

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid values: "auto", "selective" and "token"

Default: None

Required: Yes if otp_mode is "2"

okta_url

URL for Okta auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if otp_mode is "3"

okta_token

Token for Okta auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if otp_mode is "3"

okta_username_suffix

Username suffix for Okta auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

saml_enabled

Type: String

Default: "no"

Required: No

enable_elb

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: "yes" or "no"

Default: None

Required: Yes when cloud_type is "1", "4", "256" or "1024"

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

    Delete Gateway

  Description

Delete an Aviatrix gateway.

  Request Parameters

CID

The session id (API Key) returned during the login.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Type: String

Valid value: "delete_container"

Default: None

Required: Yes

cloud_type

Type of cloud service provider.

Type: integer

Default: None

Required: Yes

1: AWS

2: Azure

4: Gcloud (UCC only)

8: ARM

256: AWS GOV (UCC only)

512: Azure China (UCC only)

1024: AWS China (UCC only)

2048: ARM China (UCC only)

gw_name

A unique name of the container.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

 

  Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty String if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty String if return is "false"

  Example Request

https://192.168.0.251/v1/api?action=delete_container&CID=54557b087a48a&cloud_type=1&gw_name=gw1

  Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "result": "Gateway gw1 has been deleted."

}

    Create Peering HA Gateway

 

  Description

This API is available in version 3.2 or later releases.

Request Method: POST

  Request Parameters

action

This parameter indicates which Aviatrix API is being invoked.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

CID

API session ID

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

public_subnet

Public Subnet INFO.

Type: string

Default: None

Required: YES

Example: AWS: "CIDR~~ZONE~~SubnetName", ARM: "CIDR~~SubnetName", GCP: "CIDR~~ZONE~~VpcName", etc...

gw_name

Name of the gateway.

Type: string

Default: None

Required: YES

new_zone

A GCE zone where this container will be launched.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when cloud_type is 4.

  Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request when return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: This field is an empty string when return is "true"

results

API response results when return value is true

Type: String

Valid Values: This field is an empty string when return value is "false"

  Example Request

# curl -k --data "action=create_peering_ha_gateway" --data "gw_name=my-gw" --data "public_subnet=10.202.0.0/24" --data "CID=XXX" "https://CONTROLLER_IP/v1/api"

  Example Response 

{
    "return": true,
    "results": "my-gw-hagw is successfully created..."
}

    Create BGP Site2Cloud Connection

 

  Description

Create a Site2Cloud connection with Primary-Cloud-Gateway BGP enabled.

Available in the version 3.0.1 or later release.

  Request Parameters

action

This parameter indicates which Aviatrix API is being invoked.

Type: String

Valid value: "bgp_add_site2cloud_conn"

Default: None

Required: Yes

CID

API session ID

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_or_vnet_name

Name of VPC/VNet. The format is: VPC_ID~~VPC_NAME

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

connection_name

Name of the Site2Cloud

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

remote_gw_type

Remote gateway type. Valid value is "aws_vgw"

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

tunnel_type

Tunnel Type. Valid value is "udp"

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

bgp_enabled

Specify enabling BGP

Type: String

Default: true

Required: Yes

bgp_remote_as_num

Remote BGP gateway's ASN (Autonomous System Number)

Type: integer

Default: None

Required: Yes

bgp_advertised_networks

List of BGP Advertised-Network

Type: String. For example: "10.123.0.0/16,10.88.88.0/32". Notes: When CIDR value is given, local subnet CIDR won't be included automatically.

Default: Local Subnet CIDR

Required: no

cgw_inside_ip

Inside IP Address of AWS-Customer-Gateway (CGW)

Type: String

Default: None

Required: yes

vgw_inside_ip

Inside IP Address of AWS-VPN-Gateway (VGW) / AWS-Virtual-Private-Gateway

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

gw_name

Name of the Primary Cloud Gateway

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

remote_gw_ip

Remote Gateway IP Address

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

pre_shared_key

Pre-Shared Key

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

  Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request when return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: This field is an empty string when return is "true"

results

API response results when return value is true

Type: String

Valid Values: This field is an empty string when return value is "false"

  Example Request

$ curl -k --data "action=bgp_add_site2cloud_conn" --data "CID=SCZRrfbaP5sibquXFM18" --data "vpc_or_vnet_name=vpc-abcd1234~~aws_vpc_california" --data "connection_name=my-bgp-s2c-connection" --data "remote_gw_type=aws_vgw" --data "tunnel_type=udp" --data "bgp_enabled=true" --data "bgp_remote_as_num=65002" --data "bgp_advertised_networks=10.123.0.0/16" --data "cgw_inside_ip=169.254.10.206/30" --data "vgw_inside_ip=169.254.10.205/30" --data "gw_name=bgp-gw" --data "remote_gw_ip=52.123.123.123" --data "pre_shared_key=myqQnUkpIYrMW66eacL7buIhSWjTs36w" "https://10.88.88.88/v1/api"

  Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "results": "Connection my-bgp-s2c-connection edited successfully."

}

results

Type: String

    Update Profile Policy

 

  Description

Update security policy of an existing profile.

  Request Parameters

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Type: String

Valid value: "update_profile_policy"

Default: None

Required: Yes

CID

API session ID

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

profile_name

The name of profile whose security policy to be updated.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

policy

New security policy for the profile.

Type: String (valid JSON)

4 fields are required for each policy item: protocol, target, port and action.

Valid values for protocol: "all", "tcp", "udp", "icmp", "sctp", "rdp", "dccp"

Valid values for target: CIDRs separated by comma

e.g.: "10.30.0.0/16,10.45.0.0/20"

Valid values for port: a single port or a range of port numbers

e.g.: "25", "25:1024"

Valid values for action: "allow" and "deny"

Default: None

Required: Yes

  Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty string if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty string if return is "false"

 

  Example Request

https://54.197.89.96/v1/api?CID=57dfd1214b83f&action=update_profile_policy&profile_name=marketing&policy=[{"action": "allow", "target": "10.45.0.0/16", "port": "12002", "protocol": "udp"}]

  Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "results": "marketing policy rules have been updated..."

}

    Update VPC Access Policy

 

  Description

Update access policy of a gateway.

  Request Parameters

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Type: String

Valid value: "update_access_policy"

Default: None

Required: Yes

CID

API session ID

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_name

The name of gateway whose access policy to be updated.

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

new_policy

New access policy for the gateway.

Type: String (valid JSON)

6 fields are required for each policy item: protocol, s_ip, log_enable, d_ip, deny_allow and port.

Valid values for protocol: "all", "tcp", "udp", "icmp", "sctp", "rdp", "dccp"

Valid values for s_ip and d_ip: CIDRs separated by comma or tag names such "HR" or "marketing" etc.

e.g.: "10.30.0.0/16,10.45.0.0/20"

Valid values for port: a single port or a range of port numbers

e.g.: "25", "25:1024"

Valid values for deny_allow: "allow" and "deny"

Valid values for log_enable: "on" and "off"

Default: None

Required: Yes

  Response Elements

return

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true | false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty string if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty string if return is "false"

 

  Example Request

https://54.197.89.96/v1/api?action=update_access_policy&vpc_name=test-VPC&CID=bRlXevaqRXmn0TIoNulJ&new_policy=[{"protocol":"tcp","s_ip":"10.15.0.224/32","log_enable":"on","d_ip":"10.12.0.172/32","deny_allow":"deny","port":""}]

  Example Response

{

  "return": true,

  "results": "test-VPCSecurity policy rules have been updated..."

}

Valid Values: reason is empty String if return is "true"

results

results if return is true

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty String if return is "false"

  Example Request

https://192.168.0.251/v1/api?action=list_cidr_of_available_vpcs&CID=54557b087a48a

    ]

  }

    Create Datacenter Extension

 

  Description

Create a datacenter extension. Only available in CloudN.

 

  Request Parameters

CID

The session id (API Key) that was returned during login.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes

action

Indicating type of API to call.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid value: "create_container"

Default: None

Required: Yes

cloud_type

Type of cloud service provider.

Method: POST

Type: Integer

Default: None

Required: Yes

1: AWS

2: Azure

8: ARM

account_name

Account Name to use for launching this container.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: an existing account name

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_name

A unique name of the container.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: [a-z|A-Z|0-9|\s|\/|\+|\@|\:|\.|\-]+

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_reg

A region where this container will be launched.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "us-east-1"

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_net

A VPC Network address range selected from one of the available network ranges.

Method: POST

Type: String,e.g.: "172.16.32.0/20"

Default: None

Required: Yes

vpc_size

Size of Gateway Instance.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "t2.micro"

Default: None

Required: Yes

internet_access

Indicates whether internet access would be enabled or not.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "yes" or "no"

Valid Values: "yes", "no"

Default: "no"

Required: No

public_subnet

Indicates whether a public subnet CIDR would be assigned or not.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "yes" or "no"

Valid Values: "yes", "no"

Default: "no"

Required: No

tunnel_type

Indicates whether tunnel is TCP-based or UDP-based.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "tcp" or "udp"

Valid Values: "tcp", "udp"

Default: "tcp"

Required: No

vpn_access

Enable user access through VPN to this container.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "yes" or "no"

Valid Values: "yes" to enable user access through VPN, and "no" to disable it

Default: "no"

Required: No

vpn_cidr

VPN CIDR block

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes when vpn_access is "yes"

intra_vm_route

Indicates whether to enable intra-VM route for Azure or not.

Method: POST

Type: String, e.g.: "yes" or "no"

Valid Values: "yes", "no"

Default: "no"

Required: No

otp_mode

Two step authentication mode.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: "1": Google, "2": DUO, "3": Okta

Default: None

Required: No

vpn_user_email_domain

VPN user email domain for Google auth mode.

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

duo_integration_key

Integration key for DUO auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_otp  is "2"

duo_secret_key

Secret key for DUO auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_otp is "2"

duo_api_hostname

API hostname for DUO auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_otp is "2"

duo_push_mode

Push mode for DUO auth

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid values: "auto", "selective" and "token"

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_otp is "2"

okta_url

URL for Okta auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_otp is "3"

okta_token

Token for Okta auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_otp is "3"

okta_username_suffix

Username suffix for Okta auth mode

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

enable_elb

Specify whether to enable AWS ELB or not.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: "yes" or "no"

Default: "no"

Required: No

enable_client_cert_sharing

Specify whether to enable client certificate authentication sharing or not.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: "yes" or "no"

Default: "no"

Required: No

max_conn

Maximum connection of VPN access

Method: POST

Type: Integer

Default: 100

Required: No

split_tunnel

Specify split tunnel mode.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: "yes" or "no"

Default: "no"

Required: No

additional_cidrs

Additional CIDRs for split tunnel

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

nameservers

Name servers for split tunnel

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

search_domains

Search domains for split tunnel

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

enable_ldap

Specify whether to enable LDAP or not.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: "yes"

Default: None

Required: No

ldap_server

LDAP server address

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_ldap is "yes"

ldap_bind_dn

LDAP bind DN

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_ldap is "yes

ldap_password

LDAP password

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_ldap is "yes"

ldap_base_dn

LDAP base DN

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_ldap is "yes"

LDAP user attribute

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if enable_ldap is "yes"

Additional requirements for LDAP

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: No

Specify whether to use SSL for LDAP authentication.

Method: POST

Type: String

Valid Values: "yes"

Default: None

Required: No

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if ldap_use_ssl is "yes"

Method: POST

Type: String

Default: None

Required: Yes if ldap_use_ssl is "yes"

 

  Response Elements

API return

Type: String ("true" or "false")

Valid Values: true or false

reason

Reason of failed request if return is "false".

Type: String

Valid Values: reason is empty String if return is "true"

results

Result of a successful API call.

Type: String

Valid Values: result is empty String if return is "false"

 

  Example Request

 

$ curl -k --data "action=create_container" --data "CID=4Srzim1rv7K3ZsPPiXG2" --data "cloud_type=1" --data "account_name=my-cloud-accountaws" --data "vpc_name=my-dcx-gw" --data "vpc_reg=us-west-1" --data "vpc_net=10.55.80.0/21" --data "vpc_size=t2.micro" --data "internet_access=yes" --data "public_subnet=yes" --data "tunnel_type=tcp" --data "vpn_access=yes" --data "vpn_cidr=192.168.88.0/24" --data "max_conn=100" --data "split_tunnel=yes" --data "additional_cidrs=10.123.123.123/32" "https://10.55.0.3/v1/api"

  "result": "An email with instructions has been sent to staffs@example.com",

  "vpc_id": "vpc-5da61c38"
